paragraph.heading:
Herminium lanceum (Thunb. ex Sw.) Vuijk
,
Blumea
11: 228, 1961

subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym:
Ophrys lancea Thunb. ex Sw., Kongl. Vetensk. Acad. Nya Handl.
21: 223, 1800. Homotypic synonym:
Spiranthes lancea (Thunb. ex Sw.) Bakh.
f. & Steenis,
Blumea
6: 361, 1950. Heterotypic synonyms:
Aceras angustifolium Lindl.
, Edwards’s Bot. Reg. 18: t. 1525, 1832.
Platanthera angustifolia (Lindl.) Rchb.
f., Otia

Bot. Hamburg
.: 39, 1878.
Herminium angustifolium (Lindl.) Ridl.
in H.O.Forbes,
Nat . Wand. East. Archip
.: 519, 1885.
Monorchis angustifolia (Lindl.) O.Schwarz, Mitt. Thüring. Bot. Ges .
1: 95, 1949.

Baba et al. m-573

ident. uncertain. TENASSERIM.
Parish 250
(not located), fide Parish (1883: 200) [as
Aceras angustifolia
]. WITHOUT LOCALITY.
Toppin 3415
( E )
,
det. J . Renz
.
Distribution:— Pakistan , the Himalayas, Southeast Asia and as far east as New Guinea and north to China , Japan and Korea .

Notes:— Two collections from Shan State, Tanaka et al. 080446 and
Baba et al. m-573
, are atypical in their lip shape, with three short and equally long lobes. In their flower morphology, they are reminiscent of a similar collection from central Nepal that in a phylogenetic analysis of the genus groups with
Herminium lanceum
(B.B. Raskoti, pers. comm.).
